channel.title: NPR Topics: Space
channel.description: NPR coverage of space exploration, space shuttle missions, news from NASA, private space exploration, satellite technology, and new discoveries in astronomy and astrophysics.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 40 years after Challenger: Lingering guilt and lessons learned
item.description: Forty years after the Challenger disaster, NPR explores the engineers' last-minute efforts to stop the launch, their decades of guilt and the vital lessons that remain critical for NASA today.
item.content:encoded:
Forty years after the Challenger disaster, NPR explores the engineers' last-minute efforts to stop the launch, their decades of guilt and the vital lessons that remain critical for NASA today.

(Image credit: Thom Baur)
item.dc:creator: Howard Berkes

item.title: Images show thousands of newly-identified asteroids. And there's more to come
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to astronomer Sarah Greenstreet about her team's new discovery of the fastest-spinning large asteroid known to man.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks to astronomer Sarah Greenstreet about her team's new discovery of the fastest-spinning large asteroid known to man.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: Send your name into space aboard Artemis II
item.description: Submit your name on NASA's website if you'd like it loaded on an SD card and launched into space aboard Artemis II.
item.content:encoded: Submit your name on NASA's website if you'd like it loaded on an SD card and launched into space aboard Artemis II.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: The aurora borealis was visible in much of the U.S. last night due to a solar storm
item.description: We talk with a NOAA scientist about the Northern Lights, and why their visibility seems to be increasing.
item.content:encoded: We talk with a NOAA scientist about the Northern Lights, and why their visibility seems to be increasing.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: After a medical evacuation from space, NASA's Crew-11 returns to Earth a month early
item.description: Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.
item.content:encoded:
Four people from NASA's Crew-11 mission splashed down off San Diego, successfully completing five months aboard the International Space Station. The trip was cut short due to a medical issue.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: NASA's Crew-11 heads home from space, a month early
item.description: The four members of NASA's Crew-11 mission are heading home from the International Space Station. Their journey is ending a month early due to an astronaut with a "serious medical condition."
item.content:encoded: The four members of NASA's Crew-11 mission are heading home from the International Space Station. Their journey is ending a month early due to an astronaut with a "serious medical condition."
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: NASA set to bring astronaut (and the rest of Crew-11) home early for medical reasons
item.description: In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.
item.content:encoded:
In an unprecedented move, NASA is bringing an astronaut crew home early from the International Space Station because one astronaut has an undisclosed medical condition.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: NASA ends mission at the space station a month early due to 'medical situation'
item.description: NASA is ending its Crew-11 mission to the International Space Station a month early. The agency announced one of the four crew members has a "serious medical condition" and needs to return to Earth.
item.content:encoded: NASA is ending its Crew-11 mission to the International Space Station a month early. The agency announced one of the four crew members has a "serious medical condition" and needs to return to Earth.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: A 'medical situation' is forcing NASA to end mission at the space station a month early
item.description: NASA says a crew member on the International Space Station is unwell. The agency canceled a planned spacewalk for Thursday and is taking the rare step of ending the Crew-11 mission early.
item.content:encoded:
NASA says a crew member on the International Space Station is unwell. The agency canceled a planned spacewalk for Thursday and is taking the rare step of ending the Crew-11 mission early.

(Image credit: Gregg Newton)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Goddard Space Flight Center staff says library's closure degrades NASA's mission
item.description: The library at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland is closing after a number of disruptions and reductions by the Trump administration. Staff members say it's degrading NASA's mission.
item.content:encoded: The library at Goddard Space Flight Center in Maryland is closing after a number of disruptions and reductions by the Trump administration. Staff members say it's degrading NASA's mission.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle
